content.text:
# Spanish–American War Soldier

| mapframe = yes
| owner = City of Milwaukee
}}
Spanish–American War Soldier is a public art work created by the American Bronze Company and located in downtown Milwaukee, Wisconsin. The bronze figure depicts a uniformed soldier with an ammunition belt around his waist and a rifle in hand.
Background
The inscription on its plinth reads, "To those who served in the war with Spain, 1898 - 1902." It is located in the middle of West Wisconsin Avenue between North 9th and 10th Streets in the  near the Milwaukee Public Library.
See also
* Spanish–American War
References
